stitches with the long tail method and knit 6 row row 1 using contrast knit 50 60 68 sts place stitch marker knit to end row 2 using contrast knit to marker purl to end row 3 using main colour knit to end row 4 using main colour knit to 1 st before marker work wrap & turn or knit to marker and do a german short row double stitch see links below on how to do these row 5 using main colour knit to end garter section only row 6 using main colour knit to 1 stitch before marker and knit next stitch picking up the wrap or if doing germain short row work double stitch as one stitch slip marker purl to end note weave colours loosely along top edge this is the area you will sew up so you want it nice and flat ©2023 maree buscke pg 1 repeat the 6 row using contrast 2 on row 1 & 2 continue to repeat the 6 row alternating between contrast 1 and contrast 2 until work measures 120cm 140cm 160 cm make sure to end with a contrast 1 repeat so the stripes line up with you sew up the seam work 6 row of garter in main colour to match cast on edge bind off loosely using the purl 2 together slip remaining stitch back onto left needle and purl 2 together again repeat to end steam the edge before you sew up the seam so it s nice and flat line up the cast on edge and the bind off edge and sew up about 2/3rds of the way up making sure the stripes are lined up as you go mattress stitch is recommended weave in ends collar using main colour with right side facing pick up and knit one stitch in each row so 2 sts for every stripe you want it nice and loose to roll work 10 cm on 6 mm needles then change to 7 mm needle working another 5 10 cm bind off loosely using the purl 2 together bind off as above if you wish to work the collar flat use removeable stitch markers to mark where your starting
